abstract.p: Hewlett Packard Co will bring Internet access to poor people in developing markets across globe; company and partners from public and private sectors will sell, lease or donate $1 billion in products and services in markets in Africa, Latin America, China and Eastern Europe next year; photo (S)

block.p: An initiative announced yesterday by HewlettPackard will seek to bring Internet access to poor people in developing markets across the globe. As part of the project, Hewlett-Packard and partners from the public and private sectors will sell, lease or donate $1 billion in products and services in markets in Africa, Latin America, China and Eastern Europe next year. Hewlett-Packard officials acknowledged that developing markets for their products was an important motivation for the initiative. But Carleton S. Fiorina, the company's chief executive, said bringing computers to these markets will help people reap the economic benefits of the Internet.
